articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Heather Burns)
articles.description: All of us want to create inclusive, safe, and privacy-aware digital experiences, but where to begin? Our brand new Smashing Book, â€œUnderstanding Privacy,â€ written by Heather Burns, can help you lay the ground for future developers, designers, and project managers to build a better web for tomorrow. [Jump to the details](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/12/understanding-privacy-new-smashing-book/#about-the-book) or [get the book right away](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/printed-books/understanding-privacy/).

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: There is no universal solution for making every kind of table responsive and usable on smaller screens, so we have to rely on various patterns, which Adrian explains in this two-part series.
articles.title: Accessible Front-End Patterns For Responsive Tables (Part 2)

articles.description: In this article, Keima Kai provides a brief history of AI in web design, explores its current implications for creativity, and offers suggestions for how web designers can stay ahead of the curve.
articles.title: The Future Of Design: Human-Powered Or AI-Driven?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: â€œUnderstanding Privacy,â€ the new Smashing Book by Heather Burns, will help you create inclusive, safe and privacy-aware digital experiences. Print books are now shipping! articles.title: Itâ€™s Here! â€œUnderstanding Privacy,â€ A New Smashing Book Is Shipping Now

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Are you ready for the countdown to Christmas? This year, the web community was once again busy creating tech advent calendars jam-packed with fantastic content to sweeten your days. But which ones to follow? We help you find the right one, whether youâ€™re a front-end dev, UX designer, or content strategist.
articles.title: Advent Calendars For Web Designers And Developers (2022 Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: There is no universal solution for making every kind of table responsive and usable on smaller screens, so we have to rely on various patterns, which Adrian explains in this two-part series.
articles.title: Accessible Front-End Patterns For Responsive Tables (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Dan Donald)
articles.description: The world of design systems can be overwhelming sometimes. Thereâ€™s a lot to take in when you get into that space! In this article, Dan Donald dives into a simple component and explores some issues, complexity, and power we can encounter.
articles.title: The Anatomy Of Themed Design System Components

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Fabienne Bielmann)
articles.description: Today, weâ€™ll take a look at the Sass function that does all the work for you â€” with no media queries, no breakpoints, and no design jumps. In this article, Fabienne Bielmann explains what FabUnit stands for and why she decided to create her very own responsive magic formula.

articles.title: Document Object Model (DOM) Geometry: A Beginnerâ€™s Introduction And Guide

In this article, Michelle Barker will walk you through some of the front-end optimization tips to keep our Vue apps as efficient as possible.
articles.title: Optimizing A Vue App

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cristian DÃ­az)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
